intro: Odontotrichum sinuatum, commonly known as the sinuous toothed plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, also known as the carrot or parsley family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. It is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
